content: > *As the six lean over the murky pool and peer in, something creeps out of another behind them, quietly slithering up behind. Intent as they are on using the lights to see... anything, the creature manages to slip by unnoticed until it's right behind Mozzie, reaching out and...*
"Too murky to make anything proper out of it. And we've seen what happens when we anger the wildlife without necessity, if one wants to hazard a poke to generate a response."

Everyone roll for initiative!
If you have a character set up with SheetManager: `!init join`
If it's a 5e monster: `!init madd <monster name>`
Otherwise: `!init add <modifier> <name>`
Messages sent in this channel during combat will be recorded for research purposes. By sending messages in this channel during this combat, you agree to participate in the Avrae NLP study. See `!init nlp` for more information.

With that weapon, you can use your CHA modifier for the attack and damage rolls until you finish your next long rest. You can also use your CHA modifier for the attack and damage rolls for any of your pact weapons if you have that feature.

overrides.desc:
__**3' 12" | 138lb | Goblin | Sorcerer (Wild Magic)**__
> Barty is a rambunctious Goblin who likes to party. While Bartholomew may be their full name, only his mother ever calls him that, and he goes to long lengths to ensure nobody knows what it is.
>
> They joined this expedition by accident, having won a ticket in a game of three dragon ante and passed out on the a without really knowing what he had won.
**Personality Traits**
Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
**Ideals**
Creativity. The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)
People. I like seeing the smiles on people’s faces when I perform. That’s all that matters. (Neutral)
**Bonds**
Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday I’ll get it back.
My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
**Flaws**
Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.
I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
**Alignment**
CG

consumables.desc:

You can use this trait 2 times per long rest, and you can only use it once per turn.

actions.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
actions.snippet: As an action, you can use Channel Divinity and present your holy symbol to dispel any magical darkness within 30 ft. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 ft. (that doesn't have total cover) must make a CON saving throw (DC 13) or take 2d10 +3 radiant damage (half damage on success).

actions.name: Channel Divinity
actions.snippet: You can channel divine energy to fuel magical effects a number of times per short rest.

actions.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
actions.snippet: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a WIS saving throw (DC 13). If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can’t willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can’t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there’s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

caster.description:
Standing at a formidable 6'1", Nitar is a sturdily built, tan human appearing to be just over 20. Wearing bright yellow-orange furs, he sports the same color in his hair, an unkempt mess that lives atop his head. For weaponry, he carries some sort of horn-like gauntlet on his left arm - not the most elegant of weapons, but an effective one nonetheless.
He's a mischievous not-quite-kid, the self-proclaimed load-bearing door inspector. When he's not out helping with manual labor in the growing city, he can be found wandering its streets, taking in the sights and people from other worlds and trying (but not too hard) to keep out of trouble.

consumables.name: Shift
consumables.desc: As a bonus action, you can shift and assume a more bestial form and gain 4 temporary hit points. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert using a bonus action. You can shift 2 times per long rest.

consumables.name: Rage
consumables.desc:
As a bonus action enter a rage for up to 1 minute (10 rounds). 

You gain advantage on STR checks and saving throws (not attacks), +2 melee damage with STR weapons, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. You can't cast or concentrate on spells while raging.

Your rage ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage as a bonus action.

consumables.name: Travel Tokens
consumables.desc:
Traveling to a wilderness zone requires one travel token.
You have three travel tokens, which reset on a long rest. 
Each time you take a short rest, you regain one travel token. You can regain up to two travel tokens in this way between each long rest.
Use `!travel` to travel.

actions.name: Shift
actions.snippet: As a bonus action, you can shift and assume a more bestial form and gain 4 temporary hit points. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert using a bonus action. You can shift 2 times per long rest.

actions.name: Form of the Beast: Bite
actions.snippet:
Your mouth transforms into a bestial muzzle or great mandibles (your choice). It deals **1d8**+3 piercing damage on a hit.
Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with this bite, you regain 2 hit points, provided you have less than 18 hit points when you hit.

actions.name: Form of the Beast: Bite (Heal)
actions.snippet:
Your mouth transforms into a bestial muzzle or great mandibles (your choice). It deals **1d8**+3 piercing damage on a hit.
Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with this bite, you regain 2 hit points, provided you have less than 18 hit points when you hit.

actions.name: Form of the Beast: Claws
actions.snippet: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it’s empty. It deals **1d6**+3 slashing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you attack with a claw using the Attack action, you can make one additional claw attack as part of the same action.

actions.name: Form of the Beast: Tail
actions.snippet: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals **1d8**+3 piercing damage on a hit and has the reach property.

actions.name: Form of the Beast: Tail (reaction)
actions.snippet: If a creature you can see within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to swipe your tail and roll a d8, applying a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

actions.name: Rage
actions.snippet:
As a bonus action enter a rage for up to 1 minute (10 rounds). 

You gain advantage on STR checks and saving throws (not attacks), +2 melee damage with STR weapons, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. You can't cast or concentrate on spells while raging.

Your rage ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven’t attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage as a bonus action.

actions.name: Wildhunt Shifting
actions.snippet: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 ft. of you can make an attack against you with advantage unless you’re incapacitated.

automation.text: *Melee Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

consumables.name: Fanged Bite
consumables.desc:
Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your CON modifier, instead of your STR modifier, to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite. It deals **1d4** +2 piercing damage.
On biting a creature that isn't a Construct or an Undead, you can do one of:
- Regain hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt by the bite.
- Gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the piercing damage dealt by the bite.

consumables.desc: Imbue a Tiny nonmagical object with a magical property of your choice: 5ft. radius light, up to 6 second long recorded message, emits odor or nonverbal sound, static visual effect including up to 25 words of text. You can affect a maximum of 3 objects at a time.

actions.snippet: Imbue a Tiny nonmagical object with a magical property of your choice: 5ft. radius light, up to 6 second long recorded message, emits odor or nonverbal sound, static visual effect including up to 25 words of text. You can affect a maximum of 3 objects at a time.

actions.name: Grim Harvest
actions.snippet: Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain HP equal to twice the spell’s level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don’t gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

actions.name: Grim Harvest (Necromancy)
actions.snippet: Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain HP equal to twice the spell’s level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don’t gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

actions.name: Arcane Recovery
actions.snippet: Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover - up to a combined level of 1, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

content:
> *The party is SURPRISED! SH1 will act first, then initiative will proceed normally.*
> 
> *Suddenly, Mozzie feels a wet, slimy hand on her back, and turning around, comes face-to-face with a dripping, emaciated clawed creature! It lets out a creepy, breathy laugh as it glares at the woman...*

effects.name: Mage Armor
effects.desc:
The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier
 - The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action

automation.text: *Melee Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

content: > *Cackling, it reaches out to place its other hand on her other shoulder, and with an unnaturally strong push, shoves Mozzie right into the polluted tide pool the party's standing over!*
> *The rest of the party is also subject to the Horrific Appearance because surprise is a weird mechanic and every turn has technically passed once.*

You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

automation.text: *Melee Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

content: _But it made no difference at all!_
*Wincing at her miss, she took advantage of her smaller statue to **disengage** from the melee, circling the combatants from a short distance. (10ft movement)*

content: "What is that's not a crab!" *Nitar nearly jumps out of his skin - the illusory aura of a cat with hair standing on end all but appearing around him, hastily locking his gauntlet in place over his forearm and bringing it to bear with shaky hands.*

effects.name: Wildhunt Shifting
effects.desc: No creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're incapacitated

automation.text:
As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to 2 × your proficiency bonus.

While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're incapacitated.

content: "CANCEL THE MUD BATHS" _as they panic cast Chaos Bolt at the hag_

automation.text:
You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 + 1d6 damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
```
d8  | Damage Type
----|-------------
1   | Acid
2   | Cold
3   | Fire
4   | Force
5   | Lightning
6   | Poison
7   | Psychic
8   | Thunder```
If you roll the same number on both d8s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.

A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

fail.name: Frightened

Frightened of {{caster.name}}

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

fields.value:
You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 + 1d6 damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
```
d8  | Damage Type
----|-------------
1   | Acid
2   | Cold
3   | Fire
4   | Force
5   | Lightning
6   | Poison
7   | Psychic
8   | Thunder```
If you roll the same number on both d8s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.

A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

content: *Unclasping his whip once again, though taking a different approach first - raising a hand towards the hag. A slow crescendo of a violin rising within his head.* **"...ʏdo|ɘm ꙅiʜƚ ꙅi ƚɒʜW"** *His words come out jumbled, distorted as his hexblades curse lands upon the hag.*

embeds.title: Multiple Matches Found

onTrue.name: Hexblade's Curse

effects.name: Hexblade's Cursed
effects.desc:
Cursed by {{caster.name}}
 - They gain a bonus of {proficiencyBonus} to damage rolls against this target
 - Their attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against this target
 - If this target dies, they gain {WarlockLevel+charismaMod} hit points, or they can apply the curse to a different creature within 30 feet

automation.text:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.

A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

buttons.label: Hexblade's Curse (Heal)

automation.text: If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

buttons.verb: is healed by their targets death

onTrue.desc:
You gain a bonus of {proficiencyBonus} to damage rolls against the target
 - Your attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for {WarlockLevel+charismaMod}, or you can apply the curse to a different creature within 30 feet

onFalse.name: Hexblade's Cursed

automation.text:
As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, you die, or you are incapacitated. Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

 - You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
 - Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
 - If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

snippet_body:
-criton 19 -d {proficiencyBonus} -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +{proficiencyBonus} bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain {{int(WarlockLevel)+charismaMod}} hit points."
content_after:
-criton 19 -d 2 -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

content: "Okay team, our next goal should be to actually hit them-"

*A perfectly fine dress, now drenched in black water.
As the woman got up, spitting some of the liquid, her fangs were in full display.*

"I'm going to enjoy this more than I'll ever admit."
*Mozzie's eyes flare pink, as a needle forms in the air, trying to drive itself onto the creature's forehead*

automation.text:
You drive a disorienting spike of psychic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take 1d6 psychic damage and subtract 1d4 from the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach certain levels: 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

effects.name: Hexblade's Cursed
effects.desc:
Cursed by Keya
 - They gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Their attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

effects.name: Frightened
effects.desc:
Frightened of SH1
 - They can repeat the DC 11 Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

effects.name: Wildhunt Shifting
effects.desc: No creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're incapacitated

automation.text:
You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

effects.name: Hexblade's Cursed
effects.desc:
Cursed by Keya
 - They gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Their attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

onTrue.name: Rage
onTrue.desc:
Cannot cast/concentrate on spells
 - Ends if knocked unconscious

onFalse.name: Rage
onFalse.desc:
Cannot cast/concentrate on spells
 - Ends if knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since your last turn

automation.text:
In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action.

While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armor:

 - You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
 - When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a bonus to the damage roll that increases as you gain levels as a barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian table.
 - You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while raging.

Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

fields.name: Effect

automation.text:
You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 + 1d6 damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
```
d8  | Damage Type
----|-------------
1   | Acid
2   | Cold
3   | Fire
4   | Force
5   | Lightning
6   | Poison
7   | Psychic
8   | Thunder```
If you roll the same number on both d8s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.

A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

For the next minute, you can see any invisible creature if you have line of sight to it.

effects.name: See Invisibility
effects.desc: You can see any invisible creature if you have line of sight to it

automation.text: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Once per turn, the DM can have you roll a d20 immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect. If that effect is a spell, it is too wild to be affected by your Metamagic, and if it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

children.text: Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A remove curse spell can end this effect.

Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Once per turn, the DM can have you roll a d20 immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect. If that effect is a spell, it is too wild to be affected by your Metamagic, and if it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

effects.name: Mage Armor
effects.desc:
The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier
 - The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action

effects.name: Frightened
effects.desc:
Frightened of SH1
 - They can repeat the DC 11 Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

effects.name: Wildhunt Shifting
effects.desc: No creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're incapacitated

effects.name: Rage
effects.desc:
Cannot cast/concentrate on spells
 - Ends if knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since your last turn

effects.name: Hexblade's Curse

automation.text: If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

buttons.label: Hexblade's Curse (Heal)
buttons.verb: is healed by their targets death

effects.desc:
You gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Your attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

automation.text: *Melee Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

effects.name: Hexblade's Cursed
effects.desc:
Cursed by Keya
 - They gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Their attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

content: _And they turn blue. They look like a Verdan now, and they feel slight amounts of shame from it_
_But, the day goes on, and the reach out with a spectral hand to backhand slap the hag with... Chill Touch, imbuing it with the Tides of Chaos for a little extra sting_

automation.text:
You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

fields.name: Effect

onTrue.name: Chill Touch
onTrue.desc:
Target can't regain hit points
 - They also have disadvantage on attack rolls against {{caster.name}}

automation.text:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

effects.name: Hexblade's Cursed
effects.desc:
Cursed by Keya
 - They gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Their attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

effects.name: Chill Touch
effects.desc: Target can't regain hit points

A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

snippet_body:
-criton 19 -d {proficiencyBonus} -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +{proficiencyBonus} bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain {{int(WarlockLevel)+charismaMod}} hit points."
content_after:
-criton 19 -d 2 -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain 5 hit points."

snippet_body:
<drac2>
if ctx.alias in ["c", "check", "join", "cadd", "dcadd"]:  # Last two are specifically for the only person who uses them, Dusk Argentum#6530
  return """dis -f "Hex|The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability." """
else:
  return """-d "1d6 [hex necrotic]" -f "Hex|You deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack" """
</drac2>

effects.desc:
You gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Your attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

automation.text:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.

A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

snippet_body:
-criton 19 -d {proficiencyBonus} -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +{proficiencyBonus} bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain {{int(WarlockLevel)+charismaMod}} hit points."
content_after:
-criton 19 -d 2 -f "Hexblade's Curse|Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain 5 hit points."

snippet_body:
<drac2>
if ctx.alias in ["c", "check", "join", "cadd", "dcadd"]:  # Last two are specifically for the only person who uses them, Dusk Argentum#6530
  return """dis -f "Hex|The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability." """
else:
  return """-d "1d6 [hex necrotic]" -f "Hex|You deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack" """
</drac2>

fields.value: Proficiency with a whip allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

fields.value:
Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
• Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
• If the cursed target dies, you regain 5 hit points.

effects.name: Hexblade's Curse

automation.text: If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

buttons.label: Hexblade's Curse (Heal)
buttons.verb: is healed by their targets death

effects.desc:
You gain a bonus of 2 to damage rolls against the target
 - Your attacks crit on a 19 or 20 against them
 - If they die, heal for 5

automation.text:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.

A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

*Melee Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

fail.name: Frightened
fail.desc:
Frightened of {{caster.name}}
 - They can repeat the DC {lastSaveDC} {lastSaveAbility} saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on a success

automation.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

"You did."

*Another pink flash, as more needles form, as she whistles loudly and sharp...*

content: *Grumbling beneath his breath, this was somewhat embaressing!*
*...turning the creature into a mal-formed pin-cushion.*
Are you sure you want to end combat? (Reply with yes/no)

> *The hag stumbles backward and lets out a manic laugh as Mozzie's needles fly through the air and pierce its body, glassy eyes looking up towards the sky before it falls backwards into a pool and dissipates into nothing more than a dirty puddle.*
*Lowering her weapon, Verity did not relax just yet. Waiting, she eyed the nearest pools and kept light on her feet.* "Perhaps there more reason than the smell that people might not want to visit."
